intro: Lychnis noctiflora, commonly known as night-flowering catchfly, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive pink or red flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers have five petals and produce small, dry fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
